target.name: Sect2
target.text: Configuring Liferay for LDAP Authentication

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Using the Liferay Enterprise Admin portlet, click the Settings tab (you might need to click the >> tab to see the Settings tab).

target.name: Step
target.text: Using the Liferay Enterprise Admin portlet, click the Settings tab (you might need to click the >> tab to see the Settings tab).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the Authentication tab.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the LDAP tab.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Connection Settings, fill out the form with the values needed to map to your corporate directory:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Select Enabled.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Enabled.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Base Provider URL field, specify the IP address of your LDAP server, followed by the port number it uses (typically, 389 for non-secure connections or 636 for secure SSL connections).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Base DN field, specify the eDirectory context where ICEcore users' User objects are located (for example, ou=users,o=corporate).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Principle field, specify the full context of your eDirectory Admin User object (for example, cn=admin, ou=users, o=corporate).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Credentials field, specify the password of your eDirectory Admin user.

target.name: Step
target.text: For the search filter, use uid=@screen_name@ or cn=@screen_name@, depending on your site conventions. This should be the same LDAP attribute value that you configure ICEcore with to identify the user. For more information, see "Configuring ICEcore for LDAP Authentication" on page 21.

target.name: Step
target.text: If your LDAP is set up for password comparison, select the algorithm to use for LDAP password encryption from the Encryption Algorithm drop-down list (a blank value means no encryption, MD5 and SHA specify two different algorithms).

target.name: Step
target.text: Map the specific LDAP values you want to use for each user to the appropriate Liferay attributes.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Export Settings, we recommend deselecting the Export Enabled option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Save.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Configuring ICEcore for LDAP Authentication

target.name: Procedure
target.text: In the ICEcore Administration portlet, click Configure LDAP.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the ICEcore Administration portlet, click Configure LDAP.

target.name: Step
target.text: With Enable Schedule selected, click Schedule, then set the schedule as needed for LDAP synchronization for your ICEcore site.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Connection.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the URL field, specify the IP address or DNS hostname of your LDAP server, followed by the port number it uses (typically, 389 for non-secure connections or 636 for secure SSL connections).

target.name: Step
target.text: After the port number, type a slash (/), then specify the eDirectory context where ICEcore users' User objects are located (for example, ou=users,o=corporate).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Principal field, specify the full context of your eDirectory Admin User object (for example, cn=admin,ou=users,o=corporate).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Credentials field, specify the password of your eDirectory Admin user.

target.name: Step
target.text: Scroll down to the Users section.

target.name: Step
target.text: Set the LDAP Attribute field to cn. The LDAP attribute that identifies the user, for example: uid or cn.

target.name: Step
target.text: Map the LDAP attribute names of the user record to the ICEcore internal identifiers. The syntax is: ICEcoreId=ldapAttName, for example:

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Synchronize User Profiles (recommended).

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Register LDAP User Profiles Automatically recommended).

target.name: Step
target.text: If you want to synchronize groups:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Select Register LDAP Group Profiles Automatically (recommended).

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Register LDAP Group Profiles Automatically (recommended).

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Synchronize Group Membership (recommended).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Apply to save your Novell Teaming LDAP synchronization settings.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Run Immediately, then click Apply.

target.name: Procedure

target.name: Step
target.text: Make sure you have openssl available.

target.name: Step
target.text: Enter openssl s_client -connect ldap.company.com:636

target.name: Step
target.text: Copy everything from the Ô----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----' to the Ô----END CERTIFICATE----' lines (inclusive) into a file, such as cert.ldap (the name does not matter).

target.name: Step
target.text: Change directories to the java/bin directory, then enter (this uses the default directory path /opt/icecore/):

target.name: Step
target.text: If prompted for a password, the keystore's default password is: changeit

target.name: Step
target.text: Restart Tomcat.

target.name: Step
target.text: Make sure you use ldaps://ldap.company.com:636 as the LDAP URL, rather than the default ldap://ldap.company.com:389 (note protocol and port number changes).

target.name: Procedure
target.text: If not already present, add a MirroredFolder section to the installer.xml file.

target.name: Step
target.text: If not already present, add a MirroredFolder section to the installer.xml file.

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Set the enabled attribute to true and specify a unique ID, title, the path to the directory to share, and the users and groups that can utilize this resource. To prevent accidental modifications to the file share, set the readonly attribute to true.

target.name: Step
target.text: Set the enabled attribute to true and specify a unique ID, title, the path to the directory to share, and the users and groups that can utilize this resource. To prevent accidental modifications to the file share, set the readonly attribute to true.

target.name: Step
target.text: After updating your installer.xml file, you need to run the ICEcore installer with the Apply settings only option, and then restart ICEcore to create the resource drivers.

target.name: Step
target.text: Log into ICEcore as admin.

target.name: Step
target.text: Create a custom entry type representing mirrored files:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Go to ICEcore Administration portlet > Form and view designers > Entry designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Go to ICEcore Administration portlet > Form and view designers > Entry designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Entry definitions.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the dialog box on the right, click Add a new entry definition.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type a Caption (for example, Mirrored File entry) and Name (for example, Mirrored File entry), then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Entry form definition and click Form.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the dialog box on the right, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Standard form elements dialog box on the right, click File upload.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type a Caption (for example, Mirrored File) and Name (database name, for example, mirrored_file), select External Resource Adapter (Mirrored folder only) from the Repository system drop-down list, select the Required option, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Entry form definition > Form, click Attachments - Attachments.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the dialog box on the right, click Modify.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the "Hide this form element" option, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Entry form definition > Form, click Title - Title.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the dialog box on the right, click Modify.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the "Use file name as entry title" option, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Exit the ICEcore Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: In ICEcore, create a folder of type File folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: Within the folder, select the Manage > Modify this folder menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Mirror external folders option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the mirrored folder resource driver that you created in Step 1.

target.name: Step
target.text: (Optional) Specify a subdirectory within the resource driver's root directory structure that you want this folder to mirror.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK to make the folder a mirrored folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: Configure the mirrored folder with the custom entry type that you defined in Step 3 (Mirrored File entry):

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Within the mirrored folder, select the Manage > Configure menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Within the mirrored folder, select the Manage > Configure menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Default entry types section, select the custom entry type you defined in Step 3 (Mirrored File entry) and deselect all other entry types.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Close.

target.name: Step
target.text: Perform initial synchronization/loading by selecting the Manage this folder > Synchronize menu item from the folder listing.
